column1: The juniors themselves hardly felt the weight of their punishment more than did Grace Harlowe. Her heart was set on winning every basketball game of the series. But she wished to win fairly and honestly. Now
column2: that the juniors had been forbidden the use of the gymnasium
column3: the sophomores might practice there to their heart's content. But was that fair? To be sure the juniors had deserved their punishment
column4: but what kind of basketball could they play after having had no practice for two weeks? Besides
column5: Julia Crosby blamed her for telling what had occurred in the gymnasium. She had gone to Julia
column7: but Julia had only laughed at her and refused to listen.All this passed rapidly through Grace's mind as she walked toward the High School several mornings later. Something must be done
column8: but what she hardly knew. The game could be postponed
column9: but Grace felt that the other girls would not care to postpone it. They were heartily glad that the junior team had come to grief
column10: and showed no sympathy for them.
